intro: Centaurea spachii, commonly known as the Spanish thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring spiny leaves and purple to pinkish-blue flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it thrives in dry, sunny environments. Centaurea spachii is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
